New in and children's reading ideas

Did you child complete the Summer Reading Challenge? Find your library's medal and certificate presentation →

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

Chantry Library choose: Treasure Island, by Robert Louis Stevenson

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 9, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Chantry Library has chosen Treasure Island, by Robert Louis Stevenson.

Borrow a brilliant children's or YA book from the 2019 UKLA Book Awards shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 8, 2019

This year's UKLA Book Awards shortlist, judged by teachers, encompasses fiction, non-fiction, books in translation and verse novels.

Leiston Library choose: Room on the Broom, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 8, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Leiston Library has chosen Room on the Broom, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler.

Ipswich County and Newmarket libraries choose: The Gruffalo, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 7, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Ipswich County and Newmarket libraries have chosen The Gruffalo, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler.

Needham Market Library choose: This Is Not My Hat, by Jon Klassen

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 6, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Needham Market Library have chosen This Is Not My Hat, by Jon Klassen.

Felixstowe Library choose: We're Going on a Bear Hunt, by Michael Rosen & Helen Oxenbury

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 5, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Felixstowe Library have chosen We're Going on a Bear Hunt, by Michael Rosen & Helen Oxenbury.

Broomhill Library choose: Captain Flinn and the Pirate Dinosaurs: The Magic Cutlass, by Giles Andeae & Russell Ayto

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 4, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Broomhill Library have chosen Captain Flinn and the Pirate Dinosaurs: The Magic Cutlass, by Giles Andreae & Russell Ayto.

Capel St Mary Library choose: Dog Man, by Dav Pilkey

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 3, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Capel St Mary Library have chosen Dog Man, by Dav Pilkey.

Kesgrave Library choose: Kipper, by Mick Inkpen

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 2, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Kesgrave Library have chosen Kipper, by Mick Inkpen.

Suffolk Libraries Children's Month: authors and illustrators to watch

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 1, 2019

April 2019 is Suffolk Libraries Children's Month. We're helping parents and children find new favourites with a list of authors and illustrators we think should be more well-known.
